title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0081

segments.en: And today we're going to be going to one of those places that is really common, right?
segments.cn: 今天我们要去一个非常常见的地方，对吧？

segments.en: We're going to the hair salon.
Or maybe also called a barbershop.
segments.cn: 或者也可以叫做理发铺。

segments.en: I guess in this case it's a barbershop because it's a man who's getting his hair cut.
segments.cn: 我想在这种情况下是理发铺，因为是一个男士在剪头发。

segments.en: Okay, so before we see what happens in this barbershop, let's take a look at some of the vocabulary we might encounter in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们看看这个理发铺发生了什么之前，先来看看我们可能会遇到的一些词汇，进行词汇预览。

segments.en: Okay, we're going to look at two words that you'll hear in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们要看两个在对话中会听到的词。

segments.en: And the first one is trim.
Alright, so when you trim something... You cut just a little bit of it.
segments.cn: 好的，当你修剪某物时……你只剪一点点。

segments.en: Alright, so if I go to the hair salon to get a trim... You are going to cut only a little bit of your hair.
segments.cn: 好的，如果我去理发店修剪……你只会剪一点头发。

segments.en: You're not going to change the style and make it look different.
segments.cn: 你不会改变发型让它看起来不同。

segments.en: And I think here we've seen that it can be a verb and a noun, right?
segments.cn: 我想这里我们看到它可以是动词也可以是名词，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so I'm going to get a trim.
Or I want you to trim my hair.
segments.cn: 或者我想让你修剪我的头发。

segments.en: Alright, and what about our next word?
Now we know that this word maybe is related to something like luxury.
segments.cn: 现在我们知道这个词可能与奢华有关。

segments.en: Or formal or something like that.
Right, but in this case, or in this context, we're going to be using it a little bit different.
segments.cn: 对，但在这种情况下，或者在这个语境中，我们会用得稍微不同。

segments.en: Here in this dialogue, we'll hear nothing too fancy.
segments.cn: 在这个对话中，我们不会听到太花哨的东西。
或者没有太复杂的东西。

segments.en: Okay, so we don't want anything too fancy.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们不想要太花哨的东西。

segments.en: Alright, but with these two words in mind, I think we're ready to listen to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，但考虑到这两个词，我想我们准备好听对话了。

segments.en: Well, I just want to trim.
Oh my gosh, your hair is amazing.
I am going to work my magic on your hair.
segments.cn: 我会在你的头发上施展我的魔法。

segments.en: You are going to look like a million bucks.
segments.cn: 你会看起来像一百万美元。

segments.en: Um, can you make sure my sideburns are even and you just take a little off the top?
segments.cn: 嗯，你能确保我的鬓角是均匀的吗？你只需把顶部剪一点？

segments.en: I just love your curly hair.
You should totally let it grow out.
An afro would look great on you.
Okay, but you are going to be my masterpiece.
segments.cn: 好的，但你将成为我的杰作。

segments.en: So I think maybe his haircut is not quite what he expected.
segments.cn: 所以我想也许他的发型不是他预期的那样。

segments.en: I think he trusted the stylist a little bit too much.
segments.cn: 我觉得他对发型师信任得有点过头。

segments.en: I think the stylist had too many red bulls or something.
segments.cn: 我觉得发型师喝了太多红牛之类的。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look now at some of the language that we saw in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在来看看我们在语言收获中看到的一些语言。

segments.en: So I guess the stylist really thought this guy had nice hair, right?
segments.cn: 所以我想发型师真的觉得这个家伙的头发很好，对吧？

segments.en: We heard how he described his hair.
segments.cn: 我们听到了他是如何描述他的头发的。

segments.en: He said it was so silky, silky, silky.
segments.cn: 他说它是如此丝滑，丝滑，丝滑。

segments.en: So we know the word silk, a material, very soft and smooth material.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道丝绸这个词，一种材料，非常柔软光滑的材料。

segments.en: And when something is silky, it's very soft and smooth.
segments.cn: 当某物是丝滑的，它非常柔软光滑。

segments.en: So he said he had silky and shiny hair.
segments.cn: 所以他说他有丝滑和光亮的头发。

segments.en: So we know what shiny is.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道光亮是什么。

segments.en: So something that is shiny is you can see yourself in it.
segments.cn: 所以某物是光亮的，你可以在上面看到自己。

segments.en: Or if you look in the back of a CD, it's shiny.
segments.cn: 或者如果你看CD的背面，它是光亮的。

segments.en: So the light bounces off things that are shiny.
segments.cn: 所以光线会在光亮的物体上反射。

segments.en: Now getting into more hairstyle vocabulary.
segments.cn: 现在进入更多的发型词汇。

segments.en: He wanted to make sure that his sideburns were even.
segments.cn: 他想确保他的鬓角是均匀的。

segments.en: Well, sideburns are things that men have, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，鬓角是男人有的，对吧？

segments.en: So it's kind of like a beard.
And it's the hair that grows on your cheeks near your ears.
segments.cn: 这是在你耳朵附近的脸颊上生长的毛发。

segments.en: And now also the hairstylist suggested that he should let his hair grow out.
segments.cn: 现在发型师还建议他让头发长长。

segments.en: So what does that mean exactly?
segments.cn: 那这到底是什么意思呢？

segments.en: So you can say, let your hair grow.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，让你的头发长。

segments.en: But I guess it's more common to hear, let your hair grow out.
segments.cn: 但我想听到“让你的头发长长”更常见。

segments.en: Well, maybe it just means something a little bit different.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许这意味着稍微不同的东西。

segments.en: If I let my hair grow, I might let it grow a little bit, make it a little bit longer.
segments.cn: 如果我让我的头发长，我可能只会让它长一点，变得稍微长一点。

segments.en: But if I let my hair grow out, maybe it's short now and I'll let it get really long.
segments.cn: 但如果我让我的头发长长，也许现在是短的，我会让它变得非常长。

segments.en: So to let your hair grow out is to really change the length.
segments.cn: 所以让你的头发长长就是要真正改变长度。

segments.en: So let your hair grow out.
And our last word on language takeaway today, afro.
segments.cn: 今天我们最后一个语言要点，非洲发型。

segments.en: So if this guy let his curly hair grow out, he would have an afro.
segments.cn: 所以如果这个家伙让他的卷发长长，他就会有一个非洲发型。

segments.en: So now this hairstyle was very popular in the 70s.
segments.cn: 所以这个发型在70年代非常流行。

segments.en: It's like a big, round, curly, fluffy ball of hair.
segments.cn: 它就像一个大圆形的卷曲蓬松的头发球。

segments.en: We'll post some pictures on the website for you to get a clear idea of what this looks like.
segments.cn: 我们会在网站上发布一些图片，让你清楚地了解这是什么样子。

segments.en: So I think now we are ready to listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 所以我想现在我们准备好第二次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and look at some phrases.
segments.cn: 然后我们会回来看看一些短语。

segments.en: Well, I just want to trim.
I am going to work my magic on your hair.

segments.en: You are going to look like a million bucks.
segments.cn: 你会看起来像一百万美元。

segments.en: Um, can you make sure my sideburns are even and you just take a little off the top?

segments.en: So we have some phrases here that you might hear in a hair salon or in a barbershop.
segments.cn: 所以我们这里有一些你可能在理发店或理发店听到的短语。

segments.en: So why don't we look at those now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在为什么不在流利构建器中看看这些呢？

segments.en: The hairstylist said, don't just stand there.
So this is an interesting phrase, Marco.
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的短语，马尔科。

segments.en: I mean, it's made up of really simple words, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它由非常简单的词组成，对吧？

segments.en: But actually those words make it in order that's a little bit different.
segments.cn: 但实际上这些词的顺序有点不同。

segments.en: So why don't we hear a few examples to help us understand how to use this phrase.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不听几个例子来帮助我们理解如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: Help me take these boxes into the house.
segments.cn: 帮我把这些箱子搬进屋里。

segments.en: Don't just stand there in the rain.
So basically we can understand that if somebody tells you don't just stand there, they are expecting you to do something.
segments.cn: 所以基本上我们可以理解，如果有人告诉你别光站着，他们是希望你做点什么。

segments.en: We might use this phrase when somebody is not doing what we think they should do.
segments.cn: 当需要行动时，我们可能会用这个短语。
那我们现在为什么不继续下一个短语呢？

segments.en: So why don't we move on to our next phrase now?

segments.cn: 你看起来像一百万美元。

segments.en: You look like a million bucks.
segments.cn: 所以当某人看起来像一百万美元时，他们看起来真的很好。

segments.en: So when someone looks like a million bucks, they look really, really good.

segments.cn: 这是一种非常常见的说法，表示你看起来很好，或者某样东西看起来像一百万美元。

segments.en: So that is a very common way of just saying you look very good or something looks like a million bucks.
segments.cn: 所以这可以用于人或物，对吧？

segments.en: And our final phrase, and this one is really common in barber shops.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个短语，这个在理发店非常常见。

segments.en: Take a little off the top.
Take a little off the top.
Take a little off the top.

segments.cn: 所以这基本上意味着在顶部剪一点。

segments.en: And now can I say take a little off the sides?

segments.en: Yeah, you can say that as well.

Take a little off the sides.

segments.cn: 现在谈谈发型和不同类型的头发。

segments.en: There are some interesting ones that maybe aren't so fashionable anymore, right?
segments.cn: 有一些有趣的发型，可能现在不太时尚，对吧？

segments.cn: 实际上，英语有很多很酷的词来描述发型。

segments.en: So let's start with a couple of them.
